page.title: 01A country area
page.content: This area rises from the flat meadows by the winding river, past a sprea of farms and cottages to the hills, and up through scrubland to the open heights, one of which has a triangulation point 318m It is cut by two roads on which buses run, and many narrow lanes, often leading to a dead end or track to a farm. any houses are renovated nad lived in by 'outsiders'. There are also a fair nummber of sites of antiquity, a pond specially dug for a trout farm, converted barns, a farrier and one farm building with loot and tower and prison cell
